title: Gwyneth Paltrow rocks $1,200 sweater and skirt combo from her own G Label brand at Goop event
text:
She defied the doubters with the incredible success of her unapologetically high end lifestyle company Goop.

And Gwyneth Paltrow was fully on brand as she rocked a $1,200 outfit from her G label at a Goop event on Saturday.

The Politician actress wore a $650 merino wool Fares belted sweater and a $595.00 gunmetal grey satin Laura pleated skirt to the Goop By The Beach bash in Montecito, California.

Gwyneth was hosting the event to promote Goop's sundries standalone store at the Rosewood Miramar Beach Resort.

Her own best advertisement: Gwyneth Paltrow rocks $1,200 sweater and skirt combo from her own G Label brand at Goop event on Saturday

Star power: The Politician actress wore a $650 merino wool Fares belted sweater and a $595.00 gunmetal grey satin Laura pleated skirt to the Goop By The Beach event in Montecito, California, at which she joined chef David Kinch

Gwyneth, 47, teamed up with chef David Kinch for the bash, which saw guests shuttled from Los Angeles to Montecito in Lincoln's new Aviator and Corsair SUVs.

Upon arrival at the Rosewood Miramar Beach Resort, guests explored the new Goop store then enjoyed wine tasting at St. Supéry Estate Vineyards & Winery.

They were then shuttled to a private residence for an intimate dinner alfresco, which started with a talk by Gwyneth.

Drink up: Cocktails never looked so healthy

Drink with a view: The guests explored Gwyneth's new Goop shop before socialising

Tasting notes: The night started with some wine tasting

The coastal menu offered a first look at Kinch's soon to launch Santa Cruz County restaurant, Mentone.

The first course featured Santa Barbara sea urchin with lime and black cardamom. Next, a Riviera Salad, local spot prawns with spicy cucumber and avocado, and blue corn polenta and strawberry sofrito.

For the main course: black cod with mushroom and parmigiano risotto. And, dessert was cranberry soup with fall fruits.

As guests departed, they were given a selection of Goop 'essentials', to take home.

Just this month, Gwyneth told America's ELLE magazine's Women in Hollywood issue of her plans for her brand: 'In the '90s, when I was coming up, it was a very male-dominated field. You used to hear, "That actress is so ambitious," like it was a dirty word.

'[Now, with Goop,] my ambition has been unleashed.'

Freebies! As guests departed, they were given a selection of Goop 'essentials', to take home
description: She defied the doubters with the incredible success of her unapologetically high end lifestyle company Goop.
